nodes.text: Demiloch was a terrestrial astronomical object where an open recruitment drive was held by the Rebel Alliance's 61st Mobile Infantry sometime prior to the year 3 ABY. During the recruitment, an Imperial spy who had pretended to be a recruit shot Captain Micha Evon, the commanding officer of the company. Evon survived the shot and was unconscious for two days, eventually recovering. As a result of the incident, Lieutenant Sairgon, Evon's second-in-command, cut the recruitment drive short. The incident on Demiloch was later brought up during Evon's funeral in 3 ABY by the rebel soldier and former bounty hunter Brand.
Demiloch was mentioned in the 2015 novel Battlefront: Twilight Company, written by Alexander Freed.
